generalInfo: The 21-day tour provides you with a deeper experience of Iran. It contains a balanced combination of Iran’s history, culture, and nature. The first 11 days are devoted to Iran’s must-sees: Tehran the capital, desert cities of Kashan, Isfahan, Yazd, and finally, Shiraz, the Persian Empire remnant. The trip becomes more adventurous in the next 4 days through Persian Gulf’s mysterious islands and nature. Yet, the beauties of Iran’s natural attractions are not finished. 5 days in the northern parts will amaze you: old civilizations, hot springs by the mountain foothill, green forests, and the Caspian Sea. On this 21-day tour, you meet Iranian ethnic diversity, which entails a variety of Persian food and myriad interaction with locals. It is as if traveling to different continents in just one country.

dayInfo.description: Tehran --- Highlights: Airport pickup | Tabiat Bridge: Tehran’s largest pedestrian overpass with modern architecture | Bame Tehran: A recreational place and a full view of the city at Tehran Heights | Sa’adAbad Palace: A complex of palaces at Tehran's foothills that used to be the summer residence of two Iranian dynasties | Welcoming Dinner: Have you ever tasted Persian dishes?

Tehran --- Highlights: Golestan Palace: UNESCO World Heritage; in the center of Tehran from the 18th century | Tehran Bazaar: The old maze-like market in the heart of Tehran. This 10-kilometer path is the best place to visit people closely | National Museum of Iran: Largest Museum in Iran with many treasures of Iran's historical and ancient monuments | Treasury of National Jewels: One of the world’s richest collections of jewels and diamonds

Kashan --- Highlights: Drive to Kashan | Borujerdi House: A vast mansion with full details of Iran’s traditional architecture which was once for a wealthy merchant | Puppet Museum: An escape to the cozy world of childhood | Sultan Amir Ahmad Bathhouse: An old bath and sauna with stunning tiles, paintings, and arcs | Tepe Sialk: An ancient site and one of the world’s oldest civilizations that dates back to 6000 BC | Fin Garden: UNESCO World Heritage; A Persian Garden on the verge of the desert

Abyaneh & Isfahan --- Highlights: Abyaneh Village: A different stop at a historic red village; it is 2500 years old | Drive to Isfahan | Khaju Bridge and Si-o-se-pol Bridge: A walking tour over the Zayanderud River at a spirited hangout with songs and music

Isfahan --- Highlights: Naqsh-e Jahan Square: UNESCO World Heritage; the Iranian architecture landmark | Sheikh Lotfollah Mosque: An architectural masterpiece of Iranian mosque architecture and tilework from the Safavid Empire in the 17th century | Shah Mosque: UNESCO World Heritage; an elegant iconic dome piercing the sky | Ali Qapu Palace: The official residence of Safavid Emperors with historically valuable paintings and mosaic work | Chehel Sotoun Palace: UNESCO World Heritage; A pleasant and freshening Persian Garden | Jameh Mosque of Isfahan: UNESCO World Heritage; one of the oldest preserved mosques in Iran | Grand Bazaar of Isfahan: The elegant market of precious Persian carpets and else | House Dinner: A different supper; a Persian-style meal in an Iranian home, together with an Iranian family

Isfahan & Varzaneh --- Highlights: Vank Cathedral: A splendid old church in Jolfa, Isfahan’s Armenian neighborhood | Drive to the Varzaneh desert | Varzaneh Desert Camp: The magic of the desert’s beauty, peace of starry nights, and the shining of a salt lake

Yazd Zoroastrians --- Highlights: Chak Chak: A sacred Zoroastrian shrine in the mountain | Tower of silence: A different burial space; the Zoroastrians used to leave the corpses there for the carrion birds | Fire Temple & Museum of Zoroastrians: This temple holds a sacred fire that has been lit for more than 1500 years

Yazd --- Highlights: Jame Mosque: The great congregational site from 800 years ago with priceless picturesque architecture | Fahadan Neighborhood: The aroma of thatch within ginger adobe walls is the most memorable thing in this 1000-year-old neighborhood | Amir Chakhmaq Square: A ritual center known for its symmetrical arched cloves | Water Museum: A display of the Iranian genius freshwater system in the desert | Saheb Al Zaman Zurkhaneh: A traditional gym for Iranian martial arts | Dowlatabad Garden: UNESCO World Heritage; a lively Persian Garden in a desert city!

Abarkuh & Pasargadae --- Highlights: The Cypress of Abarkuh: The 3rd oldest tree in the world. It is 4500 years old that literally symbolizes life and hope | Abarkuh Ice House: An ancient adobe structure to store ice in the old times | Pasargadae: UNESCO World Heritage; The majestic capital of ancient Persia’s Achaemenid Great Empire dates back to 559–530 BC

Persepolis & Shiraz --- Highlights: Persepolis: UNESCO World Heritage; A ceremonial complex of ancient Persian kings, The earliest remains of Persepolis are from 515 BC | Necropolis: Ancient Iranian rock reliefs cut into the cliff, from both the Achaemenid and Sassanid periods | Tomb of Hafez: The famous poet of love and mystics rests here

Shiraz --- Highlights: Pink Mosque: The Nasir al-Mulk Mosque with its Orsi-stained glasses create a colorful spiritual feeling of awe | Vakil Complex: 3 Shiraz popular highlights; Bazaar, Mosque, and bath | Arg of Karim Khan: A castle for the king, Karim Khan, built in the 11th century | Eram Garden: UNESCO World Heritage; A Persian garden with a palace as its sparkling jewel | Shah Cheragh Shrine: A holy tomb that was erected first in the 12th century

Bandar Abbas & Qeshm --- Highlights: Flight from Shiraz to Bandar Abbas | Indians Temple: A different place in Muslim Iran; an Indian-style architecture from the late 19th century with Indian idols | Cruise to Qeshm Island | Portuguese Castle: A red castle from Portuguese colonial days in the 16th century

Persian Gulf --- Highlights: Stars Valley: The unique geological phenomenon with statues made due to the erosion of sand, earth, and stone | Naz Island: Two tidal islands, a special ecosystem for invertebrates and other aquatic animals | House Lunch: Southern families are popular for their welcoming nature. You’ll feel like a member of their family | Cruise of Hengam Island: Go around the beautiful Island to see the beach life and interact with locals at the local bazaar

Qeshm Island --- Highlights: Chahkooh Canyon: The unique geology of the erosion of sedimentary rocks along with ancient local wells | Mangrove Forests of Hara: Strange salt-water trees 3-8 meters high that submerge in the high tides | Laft Village: A historical port next to Hara Forest, and cool architecture

Hormoz Island --- Highlights: Cruise to Hormoz Island: With its colorful soils, Martian mountains, and red ochre beaches, Hormoz is truly called the rainbow island | Red Soil Beach: A crimson beach due to Hormoz’s precious red ochre soil | Silence Valley: Known as the goddess of salt with firm rock salty gem | The Valley of Statues: Tall strange-shaped rocks out of volcanic materials | Rainbow Cave: A 30-40 long cave with a colorful arc through the whole path | Turtles Beach: An isolated tidal beach that is home to turtles and sea creatures | Hormuz Carpet of Soil: A large colorful pattern out of Hormoz soils by the Persian Gulf

Tabriz --- Highlights: Transfer from Hormoz to Bandar Abas | Flight from Bandar Abas to Tabriz | Blue Mosque: The blue tilework, golden calligraphy lines, and unique patterns from the 15th century | Azerbaijan Museum: The second largest collection of Iran’s historical and precious artifacts from all eras | Iron Age Museum: A 4000-year-old cemetery with 38 buried bodies of men, women, and children | Tabriz Historic Bazaar Complex: UNESCO World Heritage; The largest covered bazaar in the world | Arg of Tabriz: One of the tallest and oldest walls in Iran, the remnant of a large fort around old Tabriz from the 14th century | Poets Tomb: Built in the mid-1970s, it holds many souls of Iranian poets, mystics, and famous people of Tabriz city.

Tabriz --- Highlights: Kandovan Rocky Village: Cave Houses, from 3000 years ago around the time when the Zoroastrian, Medes and Persians inhabited the region | Eynali Mount: Red Soil Mountains, Impressive views of Tabriz from the mountains that are sacred to the Zoroastrian community | Shahgoli Park: A large historic park with a beautiful artificial lake | House Dinner: An Iranian family invites us to their home for a homemade dinner

Ardebil --- Highlights: Drive to Ardebil | Meshgin Shahr: A city on the foothills of Sabalan with the longest suspension bridge in the Middle East | Sheikh Safi al-Din Khanegah and Shrine Ensemble: UNESCO World Heritage: A complex with bazaars, baths, squares, palaces, graveyards, and Safavid Kings’ shrines | Sarein Hot Springs: Small city full of hot springs, best place for relaxing

Jungles and Sea --- Highlights: Road trip, Hyrcanian Forests: A UNESCO World Heritage; the stretched forest from 25 to 50 million years ago is a scenic road in the north | Gisoom Beach: The unique scene of having both the Caspian Sea and the Gilan forests in one place | Anzali Port: Iran’s main port and seaside resort on the Caspian Sea

Rasht & Masuleh --- Highlights: Anzali Lagoon: A great location for bird watching and spotting unique wildlife | Rasht: One of the liveliest cities in Iran with unique nightlife and picturesque scenes | Masuleh: Interconnected buildings in the mountains of Masuleh date back to around 10 AD | Drive to Tehran
Tehran --- Highlights: Your free time | Airport Drop Off
